import Mathlib

open Set Metric

variable {n : â„•}
variable {U : Set (Fin n â†’ â„)} {f : (Fin n â†’ â„) â†’ â„}
variable (grad : (Fin n â†’ â„) â†’ (Fin n â†’ â„))
variable (Hess : (Fin n â†’ â„) â†’ (Fin n â†’ â„) â†’ (Fin n â†’ â„) â†’ â„)

/-- Let f : â„^n â†’ â„ be differentiable and H_f is continuous on a convex set U. 

We state the second order Taylor expansion with remainder o(â€–hâ€–^2) uniformly on compact subsets of U
as an Îµ-Î´ statement. We assume `grad` and `Hess` are given and `Hess` is continuous on U.
-/
theorem taylor_second_order_uniform_on_compacts
  (U_convex : Convex â„ U)
  (Hess_cont : ContinuousOn (fun x => fun u v => Hess x u v) U) :
  âˆ€ (K : Set (Fin n â†’ â„)), IsCompact K â†’ K âŠ† U â†’
    âˆ€ Îµ > 0, âˆƒ Î´ > 0, âˆ€ x âˆˆ K, âˆ€ h : Fin n â†’ â„,
      â€–hâ€– < Î´ â†’ x + h âˆˆ U â†’
        |f (x + h) - f x - inner (grad x) h - (1 / 2 : â„) * Hess x h h| â‰¤ Îµ * â€–hâ€– ^ 2 := by
  sorry

as an Îµ-Î´ statement. We assume `grad` and `Hess` are given and `Hess` is continuous on U.
-/
theorem taylor_second_order_uniform_on_compacts
  (U_convex : Convex â„ U)
  (Hess_cont : ContinuousOn (fun x => fun u v => Hess x u v) U) :
  âˆ€ (K : Set (Fin n â†’ â„)), IsCompact K â†’ K âŠ† U â†’
    âˆ€ Îµ > 0, âˆƒ Î´ > 0, âˆ€ x âˆˆ K, âˆ€ h : Fin n â†’ â„,
      â€–hâ€– < Î´ â†’ x + h âˆˆ U â†’
        |f (x + h) - f x - (âˆ‘ i : Fin n, (grad x i) * (h i)) - (1 / 2 : â„) * Hess x h h| â‰¤ Îµ * â€–hâ€– ^ 2 := by
